name: Utilitarianism: The Greatest Good
description: From Bentham's felicific calculus to effective altruism — 250 years of trying to maximize happiness and the bodies left in the calculation

name: Virtue Ethics: Character and the Good Life
description: Not what should I do, but who should I be — Aristotle's question, abandoned for two centuries, revived because the alternatives kept failing

name: Social Contract Theory: Why We Obey
description: Hobbes, Locke, Rousseau, and Rawls — the fiction that we agreed to be governed, and why the fiction matters even though nobody actually signed

name: Bioethics: Life, Death, and Medicine
description: From Tuskegee to CRISPR — the field that exists because scientists kept doing things before asking whether they should

name: Environmental Ethics: Nature and Obligation
description: Does a river have rights? Does a forest have value without humans to walk in it? The questions that determine whether civilization survives the century

name: Animal Rights and Moral Status
description: 80 billion land animals killed annually — the philosophical case for why this matters, and why knowing it matters has changed almost nothing

name: Meta-Ethics: What Is Morality?
description: The philosophy behind the philosophy — is morality discovered, invented, or expressed? 2,500 years of argument and still no consensus
